histogram.summary: Logs the permission status, stored in iOS settings, the user has given for receiving price tracking notifications on the device. Logged every time the metrics provider reports filter metrics.

histogram.name: IOS.Notifications.SafetyCheck.Dismissed
histogram.summary: Logs when a Safety Check notification that was triggered appears to have dismissed or cleared from the notification center. Will be logged when or if the app starts again, after the notification has dismissed.

histogram.name: IOS.Notifications.SafetyCheck.Interaction
histogram.summary: Logs when the user interacts with a Safety Check notification.

histogram.name: IOS.Notifications.SafetyCheck.Requested
histogram.summary: Logs when a Safety Check notification is requested to be sent to the user. Note: this does not indicate that the notification was received by the user, only that the notification was requested to be sent.

histogram.name: IOS.Notifications.SafetyCheck.Triggered
histogram.summary: Logs when a Safety Check notification that was requested appears to have triggered. Will be logged when or if the app starts again, after the notification has triggered.

histogram.name: IOS.Notifications.SendTab.MagicStack.AllowNotificationsPressed
histogram.summary: Recorded when a user taps on the 'Allow Notifications' button on the Send Tab Notifications Promo module in the Magic Stack.

histogram.name: IOS.Notifications.SendTab.Received
histogram.summary: Logs the notification permission status when a Send Tab notification is received on the target device.

histogram.name: IOS.Notifications.Tips.Cleared
histogram.summary: Logs when a tips notification is cleared by the client.

histogram.name: IOS.Notifications.Tips.ClientStatus.Enabled.ByProvider
histogram.summary: Logs the permission status, stored in iOS settings, the user has given for receiving tips notifications on the device. Logged every time the metrics provider reports filter metrics.

histogram.name: IOS.Notifications.Tips.Dismissed
histogram.summary: Logs when a Tips notification that was triggered appears to have dismissed or cleared from the notification center. Will be logged when or if the app starts again, after the notification has dismissed.

histogram.name: IOS.Notifications.Tips.Interaction
histogram.summary: Logs when the user interacts with a Tips notification.

histogram.name: IOS.Notifications.Tips.Sent
histogram.summary: Logs when a Tips notification is sent. Note: this does not indicate that the notification was received by the user.

histogram.name: IOS.Notifications.Tips.Triggered
histogram.summary: Logs when a Tips notification that was requested appears to have triggered. Will be logged when or if the app starts again, after the notification has triggered.

histogram.name: IOS.Notifications.Tips.UserType
histogram.summary: Logs when a Tips Notifications user is classified, when returning to the app after the first notification has been scheduled.

histogram.name: IOS.NSString.stringByReplacingCharactersInRange.NilArgument
histogram.summary: NSString API: stringByReplacingCharactersInRange:withString: was invoked with a nil argument.

histogram.name: IOS.NTP.Click
histogram.summary: This histogram is logged whenever a click happens on the NTP.

histogram.name: IOS.NTP.ExcessRemovedTabCount
histogram.summary: The number of excess NTP tabs that are removed.

histogram.name: IOS.NTP.Impression
histogram.summary: The type of NTP impressions on iOS, split by the feed visibility. Logged each time an NTP is made visible.

histogram.name: IOS.NTP.Impression.CustomizationState
histogram.summary: The current visibility of NTP components chosen from the customization menu. Logged each time an NTP is made visible.

histogram.name: IOS.NTP.LensButtonNewBadgeShown
histogram.summary: The result of an attempt to show the New Feature badge on the Lens button in the NTP on iOS. Logged when the NTP view is created.

histogram.name: IOS.NTP.OverscrollAction
histogram.summary: The type of overscroll action that occurs on the NTP. This is recorded each time a user overscrolls on the NTP.

histogram.name: IOS.Omaha.HoursSinceLastSuccess
histogram.summary: The elapsed (wall clock) time since the last successful Omaha ping. This is recorded each time a ping receives a success response.

histogram.name: IOS.Omnibox.DeviceSwitcherResult.{Context}
histogram.summary: Log device switcher result checked at {Context}. When results are available, logs the resuling default omnibox position. Otherwise, logs the reason.

histogram.name: IOS.Omnibox.Promo.Events.{Context}
histogram.summary: Records that the omnibox position choice screen was displayed during {Context}. Also records when the user taps the different buttons in the choice screen.

histogram.name: IOS.Omnibox.Promo.SelectedPosition.{Context}
histogram.summary: Records the selected omnibox position when the promo is presented during {Context}. Also records whether the selected position is the default one.

histogram.name: IOS.Omnibox.Promo.SelectedPosition.{Context}.{OmniboxDeviceSwitcherResult}
histogram.summary: Records the selected omnibox position when the promo is presented during {Context}. Also records whether the selected position is the default one. Record in a different buckets depending on omnibox device switcher result, current classification is {OmniboxDeviceSwitcherResult}.

histogram.name: IOS.Omnibox.Promo.TimeOpen.{Context}
histogram.summary: The amount of time the omnibox position choice screen is open during {Context}.

histogram.name: IOS.Omnibox.SteadyStatePositionAtStartup
histogram.summary: Logs the steady state (unfocused) omnibox position when starting the app.

histogram.name: IOS.Omnibox.SteadyStatePositionAtStartup.Selected
histogram.summary: Logs the selected steady state (unfocused) omnibox position when starting the app. This only logged when the position is user selected.

histogram.name: IOS.Omnibox.SuggestionsListScrolled.{PageClass}
histogram.summary:
For every interaction with the Omnibox, this metric records whether the user scrolled the omnibox while exploring suggestions on {PageClass}.
This is recorded once per Omnibox interaction, regardless of whether the User chooses to navigate somewhere or abandons the interaction.

histogram.name: IOS.OpenIn.DownloadResult
histogram.summary: The result of the download operation done when the user taps "open in" button to open a file by a different application.

histogram.name: IOS.OpenIn.MimeType
histogram.summary: The MIME type of the previwed file when the "Open In" toolbar is presented.

histogram.name: IOS.OpenInExtensionOutcome
histogram.summary: The outcome of the Open Extension. Logged on the next Chrome startup. May be undercounted if Open Extension is often used without opening Chrome.

histogram.name: IOS.OverflowMenu.ActionType
histogram.summary: The type of action the user took in the overflow/tools menu

histogram.name: IOS.OverflowMenu.Customization.ActionAdded
histogram.summary: The action added during an overflow menu customization.

histogram.name: IOS.OverflowMenu.Customization.ActionRemoved
histogram.summary: The action removed during an overflow menu customization.

histogram.name: IOS.OverflowMenu.Customization.ActionsCustomized
histogram.summary: A bitfield value representing various sub-events that can take place during an action customization session. Only fired when some customization actually occurred.

histogram.name: IOS.OverflowMenu.Customization.ActionsReordered.FirstPosition
histogram.summary: The action in the first position after reordering the menu.

histogram.name: IOS.OverflowMenu.Customization.ActionsReordered.FourthPosition
histogram.summary: The action in the fourth position after customizing the menu.

histogram.name: IOS.OverflowMenu.Customization.ActionsReordered.SecondPosition
histogram.summary: The action in the second position after customizing the menu.

histogram.name: IOS.OverflowMenu.Customization.ActionsReordered.ThirdPosition
histogram.summary: The action in the third position after customizing the menu.

histogram.name: IOS.OverflowMenu.Customization.DestinationAdded
histogram.summary: The destination added during an overflow menu customization.

histogram.name: IOS.OverflowMenu.Customization.DestinationRemoved
histogram.summary: The destination removed during an overflow menu customization.

histogram.name: IOS.OverflowMenu.Customization.DestinationsCustomized
histogram.summary: A bitfield value representing various sub-events that can take place during a destination customization session. Only fired when some customization actually occurred.

histogram.name: IOS.OverflowMenu.Customization.DestinationsReordered.FirstPosition
histogram.summary: The destination in the first position after the user manually reordered the menu.

histogram.name: IOS.OverflowMenu.Customization.DestinationsReordered.FourthPosition
histogram.summary: The destination in the fourth position after the user manually reordered the menu.

histogram.name: IOS.OverflowMenu.Customization.DestinationsReordered.SecondPosition
histogram.summary: The destination in the second position after the user manually reordered the menu.

histogram.name: IOS.OverflowMenu.Customization.DestinationsReordered.ThirdPosition
histogram.summary: The destination in the third position after the user manually reordered the menu.

histogram.name: IOS.OverflowMenu.DestinationsOrderChangedProgrammatically
histogram.summary: The cause of the overflow menu being programatically reordered when it is reordered.

histogram.name: IOS.OverflowMenu.OverflowMenuVisited
histogram.summary: A bitfield value representing various sub events that can take place when visiting the overflow menu. Fired once per visit, when the menu closes.

histogram.name: IOS.OverflowMenu.SmartSortingStateChange
histogram.summary: Whether Smart Sorting was newly enabled or disabled when the state changed.

histogram.name: IOS.OverflowMenu.TimeOpen
histogram.summary: The amount of time the overflow/tools menu is open.

histogram.name: IOS.OverflowMenu.TimeOpen.ActionChosen
histogram.summary: The amount of time the overflow/tools menu is open and an action (the vertical list) is selected.

histogram.name: IOS.OverflowMenu.TimeOpen.DestinationChosen
histogram.summary: The amount of time the overflow/tools menu is open and a destination (the horizontal list) is selected.

histogram.name: IOS.OverflowMenu.UserScrolledToEndAndStartedCustomization
histogram.summary: Fired whenever the user ends an overflow menu session after having scrolled to the end of the menu. Records whether the user started the menu customization flow during that session.

histogram.name: IOS.PageLoad.DefaultModeMobile
histogram.summary: Tracks the default mode used by the webview when a page is loaded. True when the default mode is Mobile (vs Default).

histogram.name: IOS.PageLoadCount.Counts
histogram.summary: The number of navigation started events by navigation type.

histogram.name: IOS.PageLoadCount.LoadingStarted
histogram.summary: The "true" value of this boolean histogram counts the number of page loading started events. The "false" value will never be seen.

histogram.name: IOS.PageLoadedSnapshotResult
histogram.summary: Tracks the result of snapshotting when the page has been loaded.

histogram.name: IOS.PageLoadTiming.OmnibarToPageLoaded
histogram.summary: Measures the time from the end of user input in the omnibox to when the page is fully loaded. Only measures page loads initiated by user typing a URL or selecting a suggested entry from the URL bar.

histogram.name: IOS.ParcelTracking.OptIn.ActionOnPrompt
histogram.summary: Logs a user's action on the Parcel Tracking Opt-In prompt.

histogram.name: IOS.ParcelTracking.OptIn.Displayed
histogram.summary: Logs each time when the Parcel Tracking Opt-In prompt is displayed.

histogram.name: IOS.ParcelTracking.OptInStatus
histogram.summary: Logs the opt-in status the user has given for whether or not they allow parcel tracking on the device. Logged once per app start. For users who have not yet interacted with the opt-in prompt, new users on M127 will log StatusNotSet, while users before M127 will log AskToTrack.

histogram.name: IOS.ParcelTracking.Tracked.{Source}
histogram.summary: Logs number of packages tracked from {Source}.

variant.name: AutoTrack
variant.summary: Recorded when package(s) are tracked automatically.

variant.name: Infobar
variant.summary: Recorded when package(s) are tracked from an infobar.

variant.name: LongPress
variant.summary: Recorded when package(s) are tracked from long pressing on a package number.

histogram.name: IOS.ParcelTracking.Untracked.{Source}
histogram.summary: Logs number of packages untracked from {Source}.

variant.name: Infobar
variant.summary: Recorded when package(s) are untracked from an infobar.

variant.name: MagicStack
variant.summary: Recorded when package is untracked from the Magic Stack.

histogram.name: IOS.PartialTranslate.Outcome
histogram.summary: The outcome of the partial translate feature.

histogram.name: IOS.PartialTranslate.SelectionLength
histogram.summary: The length of the selection received from javascript.

histogram.name: IOS.PasswordBottomSheet.Activated
histogram.summary: Tracks whether the password suggestion bottom sheet is activated. Recorded when a password form is parsed with available credentials, which corresponds to the moment where the bottom sheet listeners are attached.

histogram.name: IOS.PasswordBottomSheet.ExitReason
histogram.summary: Tracks the bottom sheet dismissal, use of a password suggestion and long press menu events.

histogram.name: IOS.PasswordManager.BulkSavePasswordsInAccountCount
histogram.summary: The number of local passwords the user has moved to their account using the bulk save passwords in account module in password manager settings. This is logged when the user chooses to bulk move their passwords to their account.

histogram.name: IOS.PasswordManager.Favicons.Percentage
histogram.summary: The percentage of passwords that have a favicon that is an image in the Password Manager recorded when the view will disappear.

histogram.name: IOS.PasswordManager.WidgetPromo.Action
histogram.summary: [iOS Only] Tracks the actions taken by the user on the Password Manager widget promo.

histogram.name: IOS.PaymentsBottomSheet.AcceptAttempts.{Action}
histogram.summary: Counts the number of attempts done for accepting a payment suggestion before an {Action} on the payments sheet was really handled. Recorded when the user does an effective action on the sheet such as accepting a selected suggestion or dismissing the sheet. Won't be recorded if the action couldn't be handled yet.

histogram.name: IOS.PaymentsBottomSheet.ExitReason
histogram.summary: Tracks the bottom sheet dismissal or use of a payments suggestion.

histogram.name: IOS.Permission.Modal.Events
histogram.summary: Logs media permission events when the user changes the state of a permission (e.g. the microphone permission) from the infobar modal.

histogram.name: IOS.Permission.PageInfo.Events
histogram.summary: Logs media permission events when the user changes the state of a permission (e.g. the microphone permission) from the page info.

histogram.name: IOS.Permission.Requests
histogram.summary: Logs media permission requests from websites. (e.g. the microphone permission is asked from a website).

histogram.name: IOS.PostDefaultAbandonmentPromo.UserAction
histogram.summary: Records which action the user took when the post-default browser abandonment promo was displayed. Recorded once per promo impression, when the promo is dismissed.

histogram.name: IOS.PostRestoreDefaultBrowser.ActionOnPrompt
histogram.summary: Logs a user's action on the Post Restore Default Browser promo.

histogram.name: IOS.PostRestoreSignin.Choice
histogram.summary: Logs a user's choice when presented with the Post Restore Signin Promo. Note: this metric got expired for a while between 2024-03-31 and 2024-11-07.

histogram.name: IOS.PostRestoreSignin.Displayed
histogram.summary: Indicates whether the Post Restore Signin Promo was displayed. Note: this metric got expired for a while between 2024-03-31 and 2024-11-07.

histogram.name: IOS.PriceInsights.Model.CanTrack
histogram.summary: Whether or not the current URL and the user are eligible for tracking on page load.

histogram.name: IOS.PriceInsights.Model.IsSubscribed
histogram.summary: Whether or not the current url is currently being tracked on page load.

histogram.name: IOS.PriceInsights.Model.PriceInsightsInfo
histogram.summary: Whether or not PriceInsightsInfo was available on page load.

histogram.name: IOS.PriceInsights.Model.ProductInfo
histogram.summary: Whether or not ProductInfo was available on page load.

histogram.name: IOS.Process.ActivePrewarm
histogram.summary: Whether or not the process was started with ActivePrewarm, an Apple triggered launch of a nonrunning application processes to reduce the amount of time the user waits before the app is usable. A significant change in this metric may indicate a change from Apple outside Chromium's control, or that Chromium has a reduced 'Duet' score in the system, which merits investigation. See the UIKit documentation "Prepare Your App for Prewarming" for more details.

histogram.name: IOS.PromosManager.EligiblePromosInQueueCount
histogram.summary: Logs number of eligible for display promos in the promos manager's queue when next promo to display is identified. Recorded only if there is at least 1 eligible promo.

histogram.name: IOS.PromosManager.Promo
histogram.summary: Logs which promo is displayed when the Promos Manager decides to display a promo.

histogram.name: IOS.PromosManager.Promo.DisplayFailure
histogram.summary: Logs which promo failed to display. This happens when a promo is requested for display, but isn't properly registered. This seldom happens in practice, but may happen during manual testing by disabling a promo right before the Promos Manager attempts to display it.

histogram.name: IOS.PromosManager.Promo.ForcedDisplayFailure
histogram.summary: Logs which forced promo failed to display. This happens when a promo is forced for display (via Experimental Settings toggle,) but isn't properly registered (via chrome://flags). This seldom happens in practice, but may happen during manual testing.

histogram.name: IOS.PromosManager.Promo.Type
histogram.summary: Logs which type of promo is displayed when the Promos Manager decides to display a promo.

histogram.name: IOS.PushNotification.APNSDeviceRegistration
histogram.summary: Logs whether the user's device was or was not able to successfully register with APNS and retrieve an APNS device token. An APNS device token is needed to successfully register the user's device with Chime. This histogram is logged during application startup and each time the user signs into an account.

histogram.name: IOS.PushNotification.ChimeDeviceRegistration
histogram.summary: Logs whether the user's device was or was not able to successfully register with Chime. The device is registered with Chime on the application's start-up if the difference between the previous time the device was registered with Chime and the current application start-up is greater than the predefined time interval threshold (currently set at one day).

histogram.name: IOS.PushNotification.ChimePreferenceRegistration
histogram.summary: Logs whether the user's push notification permissions for each push notification enable feature in Chrome were successfully applied to the Chime server during the device registration process.

histogram.name: IOS.PushNotification.Client.Disabled
histogram.summary: Logs that a particular Push Notification Client was disabled by the user.

histogram.name: IOS.PushNotification.Client.Enabled
histogram.summary: Logs that a particular Push Notification Client was enabled by the user.

histogram.name: IOS.PushNotification.EnabledPermisisons
histogram.summary: Logs whether the user decided to allow/disallow push notification permissions for the current device or an error occured. This is logged each time the user responds to a push notification permission prompt.

histogram.name: IOS.PushNotification.IncomingNotificationProcessingTime
histogram.summary: Logs the amount of time it takes for Chrome to process an incoming notification. iOS allows applications to process notifications and fetch any additional data needed for up to 30 seconds. iOS tracks the amount of power Chrome uses, the time it takes for it to finish processing the incoming notification, and data costs for background downloads. According to the documentation, if iOS determines that Chrome uses significant amounts of power when processing remote notifications, iOS may not always wake up Chrome early to process future notifications. Thus, this histogram uses processing time as a proxy for iOS' three parameters.

histogram.name: IOS.PushNotification.LifecyleEvents
histogram.summary: Logs various lifecycle stages a push notification can observe on the device. This histogram is logged each time a push notification is received on the device, displayed while Chrome is in the foreground, and tapped by the user. An important stipulation to note is that if Chrome is neither in the foreground nor the background and a push notification is received on the device, iOS will not notify Chrome of this reception and thus will not be represented in the histogram. Therefore, when interpreting this metric, the push notification reception count may be lower than in reality.

histogram.name: IOS.PushNotification.NotificationAutorizationStatusChangedToAuthorized
histogram.summary: Logs the push notification iOS settings permission status the user's device was previously in before the user updated their push notifications permission status to enable push notifications. This histogram is logged only when push notification permission status has changed and Chrome makes an APNS device token request.

histogram.name: IOS.PushNotification.NotificationAutorizationStatusChangedToDenied
histogram.summary: Logs the push notification iOS settings permission status the user's device was previously in before the user updated their push notifications permission status to disable push notifications. This histogram is logged only when push notification permission status has changed and Chrome makes an APNS device token request.

histogram.name: IOS.PushNotification.NotificationAutorizationStatusChangedToProvisional
histogram.summary: Logs the push notification iOS settings permission status the user's device was previously in before their push notifications permission status changed to provisional. This histogram is logged only when push notification permission status has changed and Chrome makes an APNS device token request.

histogram.name: IOS.PushNotification.NotificationSettingsAuthorizationStatus
histogram.summary: Logs the permission status, stored in iOS settings, the user has given for whether Chrome can receive push notifications on the device. This histogram is logged each time Chrome requests the device's APNS token from the APNS server.

histogram.name: IOS.PushNotification.NotificationSettingsAuthorizationStatus.ByProvider
histogram.summary: Logs the permission status, stored in iOS settings, the user has given for whether Chrome can receive push notifications on the device. Logged every time the metrics provider reports filter metrics.

histogram.name: IOS.PushNotification.ProminenceAlert.Result
histogram.summary: Logs the action the user takes on the alert informing the user that their notifications are being delivered silently.

histogram.name: IOS.PushNotification.Provisional.EnabledPermissisons
histogram.summary: Logs whether the provisional push notification permissions were granted for the current device or an error occured. This is logged each time the device responds to a provisional notification permission request.

histogram.name: IOS.ReadingList.BulkAddURLsCount
histogram.summary: The number of URLs a user has successfully added to Chrome Reading List via bulk addition (Siri Shortcut). This count is taken after checking for possibly invalid URLs inputted.

histogram.name: IOS.ReadingList.ImageTooLargeFailure
histogram.summary: Distillation of the page failed because an image was too big (>1MB). Recorded on distillation attempt.

histogram.name: IOS.ReadingList.PageTooLargeFailure
histogram.summary: Distillation of the page failed because the page was too big (>10MB). Recorded on distillation attempt.

histogram.name: IOS.Reauth.Address.Autofill
histogram.summary: Tracks the results and attempts of reauthentication when using address Autofill suggestions.

histogram.name: IOS.Reauth.CreditCard.Autofill
histogram.summary: Tracks the results and attempts of reauthentication when using credit card Autofill suggestions.

histogram.name: IOS.Reauth.Password.Autofill
histogram.summary: Tracks the results and attempts of reauthentication when using password Autofill suggestions.

histogram.name: IOS.Reauth.Password.BottomSheet
histogram.summary: Tracks the results and attempts of reauthentication when using suggestions from the password bottom sheet.

histogram.name: IOS.Reauth.Password.ManualFallback
histogram.summary: Tracks the results and attempts of reauthentication when using a password in Manual Fallback.

histogram.name: IOS.ReconcileEULAPref
histogram.summary: Track the reconciliation of EULA pref and First run sentinel. Reported once on startup when it is detected that EULA pref is not set but First run sentinel is set. There is no base event (false) as this should be an exceptional case and should tend to 0 occurence.

histogram.name: IOS.ResetDismissCount.Password.BottomSheet
histogram.summary: Tracks the number of times in a row the Password Bottom Sheet had been dismissed at the moment the dismiss count was reset to 0 (between 1 and 3).

histogram.name: IOS.RestoreNavigationItemCount
histogram.summary: [iOS] The number of items Navigation Manager was requested to restore. 100 is logged when the number of navigation items is greater than 100. This is just a requested count and actual number of restored items can be smaller. Restoration is triggered in the following cases (the list is not exhaustive): app cold start, remote tab was open, cookie were cleared, recently closed tab was restored.

histogram.name: IOS.SadTab.FileIsPDF
histogram.summary: This histgram counts the frequency of sad tabs that occur while loading a PDF file. This is logged once per sad tab shown.

histogram.name: IOS.SadTab.URLIsChromeExternalFile
histogram.summary: This histgram counts the frequency of sad tabs that occur while loading a chrome://external-file URL. This is logged once per sad tab shown.

histogram.name: IOS.SafeBrowsing.Enhanced.Infobar.Interaction
histogram.summary: This histogram tracks the Enhanced Safe Browsing Infobar promo's conversion rate by comparing how many times the infobar is surfaced to users and how many times it is tapped on.

histogram.name: IOS.SafeBrowsing.RedirectedRequestResponseHostsMatch
histogram.summary: The URL in a navigation request should have the same host as the URL in the corresponding response, but this sometimes doesn't hold after a server redirect because of a WKWebView bug. This histogram counts the frequency of this invariant violation, and is logged each time that a main-frame navigation response is received after a server redirect. True means that the request and response URLs have the same host.

histogram.name: IOS.SafetyCheck.FreshnessTrigger
histogram.summary: This histogram logs the reason for signaling freshness to the Segmentation Platform when the Safety Check Manager updates the freshness status.

histogram.name: IOS.SafetyCheck.MagicStack.HiddenReason
histogram.summary: This histogram logs the reason why the Safety Check module is hidden in the Magic Stack.

histogram.name: IOS.SandboxMetrics.ApplicationSupportSize
histogram.summary: The amount of storage used by the "Application Support" directory excluding the storage used by all currently open tabs. Logged at application startup, maximum once every 2 weeks, if the `kLogApplicationStorageSizeMetrics` flag is enabled.

histogram.name: IOS.SandboxMetrics.AverageColorSnapshotSize
histogram.summary: The average amount of storage used by a color snapshot image for this user. Logged at application startup, maximum once every 2 weeks, if the `kLogApplicationStorageSizeMetrics` flag is enabled.

histogram.name: IOS.SandboxMetrics.AverageGreySnapshotSize
histogram.summary: The average amount of storage used by a grey snapshot image for this user. Logged at application startup, maximum once every 2 weeks, if the `kLogApplicationStorageSizeMetrics` flag is enabled.

histogram.name: IOS.SandboxMetrics.ChromeCacheSize
histogram.summary: The amount of storage used by the Chrome cache directory. Logged at application startup, maximum once every 2 weeks, if the `kLogApplicationStorageSizeMetrics` flag is enabled.

histogram.name: IOS.SandboxMetrics.ChromeTempSize
histogram.summary: The amount of storage used by the Chrome tmp directory. Logged at application startup, maximum once every 2 weeks, if the `kLogApplicationStorageSizeMetrics` flag is enabled.

histogram.name: IOS.SandboxMetrics.DocumentsSize2
histogram.summary: The total amount of storage used by the application Documents directory. Chrome uses this directory to store files downloaded by the user. Logged at application startup, maximum once every 2 weeks, if the `kLogApplicationStorageSizeMetrics` flag is enabled.

histogram.name: IOS.SandboxMetrics.FaviconsSize
histogram.summary: The total amount of storage used by the favicons file. Logged at application startup, maximum once every 2 weeks, if the `kLogApplicationStorageSizeMetrics` flag is enabled.

histogram.name: IOS.SandboxMetrics.LibrarySize
histogram.summary: The total amount of storage used by the application Library directory. Chrome uses this directory to store application data and caches. Logged at application startup, maximum once every 2 weeks, if the `kLogApplicationStorageSizeMetrics` flag is enabled.

histogram.name: IOS.SandboxMetrics.OptimizationGuideModelDownloadedItems
histogram.summary: The number of download directories used by the optimization guide model downloads. Logged at application startup, maximum once every 2 weeks, if the `kLogApplicationStorageSizeMetrics` flag is enabled.

histogram.name: IOS.SandboxMetrics.OptimizationGuideModelDownloadsSize
histogram.summary: The total amount of storage used by the optimization guide model downloads. Logged at application startup, maximum once every 2 weeks, if the `kLogApplicationStorageSizeMetrics` flag is enabled.

histogram.name: IOS.SandboxMetrics.TotalOTRSessionSize
histogram.summary: The total amount of storage used by the currently open incognito tabs. This includes both the storage used for current tab state and the associated snapshot images. Logged at application startup, maximum once every 2 weeks, if the `kLogApplicationStorageSizeMetrics` flag is enabled.

histogram.name: IOS.SandboxMetrics.TotalRegularSessionSize
histogram.summary: The total amount of storage used by the currently open regular (non incognito) tabs. This includes both the storage used for current tab state and the associated snapshot images. Logged at application startup, maximum once every 2 weeks, if the `kLogApplicationStorageSizeMetrics` flag is enabled.

histogram.name: IOS.SandboxMetrics.WebKitCacheSize
histogram.summary: The amount of storage used by the WebKit cache directory. Logged at application startup, maximum once every 2 weeks, if the `kLogApplicationStorageSizeMetrics` flag is enabled.

histogram.name: IOS.SandboxMetrics.WebKitTempSize
histogram.summary: The amount of storage used by the WebKit tmp directory. Logged at application startup, maximum once every 2 weeks, if the `kLogApplicationStorageSizeMetrics` flag is enabled.

histogram.name: IOS.SandboxMetrics.WebsiteLocalData
histogram.summary: The amount of storage used by the "Library/WebKit/WebsiteData/Default" directory which stores IndexedDB and Local Storage data for websites. Logged at application startup, maximum once every 2 weeks, if the `kLogApplicationStorageSizeMetrics` flag is enabled.

histogram.name: IOS.SaveToDrive.UI.FileSizeMB.{Outcome}
histogram.summary: Logged the Save to Drive UI is dismissed, indicating the size of the file to download, as a function of the final outcome of the UI flow e.g. whether the user canceled, whether they selected Drive or Files, etc. Only logged if the size is available.

histogram.name: IOS.SaveToDrive.UI.ManageStorageAlert.Cancelled
histogram.summary: Logged when an alert was shown to let the user manage their Drive storage. Reports whether the user cancelled or instead opted to manage their Drive storage.

histogram.name: IOS.SaveToDrive.UI.ManageStorageAlert.Shown
histogram.summary: Logged when the user attempts to select Drive as destination for their download. Reports whether an alert was shown to let the user manage their Drive storage.

histogram.name: IOS.SaveToDrive.UI.MimeType.{Outcome}
histogram.summary: Logged the Save to Drive UI is dismissed, indicating the MIME type of the file to download, as a function of the final outcome of the UI flow e.g. whether the user canceled, whether they selected Drive or Files, etc.

histogram.name: IOS.SaveToDrive.UI.NumberOfAttempts.{Outcome}
histogram.summary: Logged the Save to Drive UI is dismissed, indicating the number of attempts to select a destination (i.e. number of times "Save" was tapped) as a function of the final outcome of the UI flow e.g. whether the user canceled, whether they selected Drive or Files, etc.

histogram.name: IOS.SaveToDrive.UI.Outcome
histogram.summary: Logged before dismissing the Save to Drive UI i.e. the file destination and account selection view. Describes what destination was picked, whether the user cancelled or not, etc.

histogram.name: IOS.SaveToDrive.UploadTask.FileSizeMB.{FinalState}
histogram.summary: Logged when a Drive upload task's destructor is called, indicating the the size of the uploaded file as a function of the final state of the task e.g. Not Started, Cancelled, Completed or Failed.

histogram.name: IOS.SaveToDrive.UploadTask.FinalState
histogram.summary: Logged when a Drive upload task's destructor is called, indicating the final state of the task e.g. Not Started, Cancelled, Completed or Failed.

histogram.name: IOS.SaveToDrive.UploadTask.MimeType.{FinalState}
histogram.summary: Logged when a Drive upload task's destructor is called, indicating the the MIME type of the uploaded file as a function of the final state of the task e.g. Not Started, Cancelled, Completed or Failed.

histogram.name: IOS.SaveToDrive.UploadTask.NumberOfAttempts.{FinalState}
histogram.summary: Logged when a Drive upload task's destructor is called, indicating the number of attempts to complete the task (i.e. number of times it was started) as a function of the final state of the task e.g. Not Started, Cancelled, Completed or Failed.

histogram.name: IOS.SaveToDrive.{QueryType}.ErrorCode
histogram.summary: Logged when receiving the response for a failed Drive query, indicating the error code associated with the response.

histogram.name: IOS.SaveToDrive.{QueryType}.Successful
histogram.summary: Logged when receiving the response for a Drive query, indicating whether the response is successful or not.

histogram.name: IOS.SaveToPhotos
histogram.summary: Logged before the "Save to Photos" UI is dismissed with the result i.e. whether upload succeeded or failed, reason of the failure if any and whether any action was performed after the upload, such as opening the Photos app or showing StoreKit.

histogram.name: IOS.SaveToPhotos.AccountPicker
histogram.summary: Logged after the "Save to Photos" UI knows what account to use as destination for the photo to be saved i.e. an account saved in preferences as the default (account picker skipped), or an account selected with the account picker, or no account if the user cancels.

histogram.name: IOS.SaveToPhotos.ContextMenu
histogram.summary: Logged when the user performs an action from the context menu which appears after long pressing an image in a web page.

histogram.name: IOS.SaveToPhotos.GTLRErrorObjectDomainErrorCode
histogram.summary: Logged when the Photos service returns an error with domain GTLRErrorObjectDomain. The recorded value is the error code interpreted as a HTTP response code.

histogram.name: IOS.SaveToPhotos.Settings
histogram.summary: Logged when the Photos service starts. It gives information about the state of the Save to Photos settings i.e. (a) if a default account has been set, and if so, if the account still exists on the device; (b) if the user did opt-in to skip the account picker by disabling the "Ask which account to use every time" switch.

histogram.name: IOS.SaveToPhotos.UploadFailureLatency
histogram.summary: Logged when the Photos service completes an image upload with failure. It records the time elapsed between the moment the upload request is submitted to the service and the moment the service calls the provided completion callback. In particular, this includes the time necessary to create a destination album if necessary, upload the media item and add it to the destination album. See IOS.SaveToPhotos.UploadSuccessLatency for recording of successful completion.

histogram.name: IOS.SaveToPhotos.UploadFailureType
histogram.summary: Logged when the Photos service completes an image upload with failure. It records the type of failure which occurred.

histogram.name: IOS.SaveToPhotos.UploadSuccessLatency
histogram.summary: Logged when the Photos service completes an image upload with success. It records the time elapsed between the moment the upload request is submitted to the service and the moment the service calls the provided completion callback. In particular, this includes the time necessary to create a destination album if necessary, upload the media item and add it to the destination album. See IOS.SaveToPhotos.UploadFailureLatency for recording of unsuccessful completion.

histogram.name: IOS.SearchExtension.Action
histogram.summary: The action selected by the user in the Search Extension.

histogram.name: IOS.SearchExtension.DisplayCount
histogram.summary: The number of times the Search Extension was displayed since last Chrome foregrounding. Reported when Chrome is put in foreground. Note: events where the count is zero were removed in M91.

histogram.name: IOS.SearchWith.Trigger
histogram.summary: The context in which Search With has been triggered.

histogram.name: IOS.SessionMigration
histogram.summary: Record whether the session (list of tabs, and their snapshots) was migrated from one place to another. This migration can happen when the user update Chrome, their device version of iOS or when they restore a backup. The event is recorded for all Browser creation, so most of the event should be "No Migration".

histogram.name: IOS.SetUpList.AllItemsCompleted
histogram.summary: This histogram counts the number of times that all items in the Set Up List are completed.

histogram.name: IOS.SetUpList.Displayed
histogram.summary: This histogram counts the number of times the Set Up List is shown on the NTP.

histogram.name: IOS.SetUpList.ItemCompleted
histogram.summary: This histogram counts the number of times Set Up List items are completed. It is recorded when the Set Up List item is marked complete in prefs, or when Set Up List is loaded and the code detects that an item was completed since the last time Set Up List was displayed.

histogram.name: IOS.SetUpList.ItemDisplayed
histogram.summary: This histogram counts the number of times Set Up List items are displayed.

histogram.name: IOS.SetUpList.ItemSelected
histogram.summary: This histogram counts the number of times Set Up List items are selected.

histogram.name: IOS.ShareExtension.ReceivedEntriesCount
histogram.summary: The number of items received simultaneously in Chrome from the IOS share extension.

histogram.name: IOS.ShareExtension.ReceivedEntry
histogram.summary: Type of the item received from the iOS share extension.

histogram.name: IOS.ShareExtension.ReceivedEntryDelay
histogram.summary: The delay in milliseconds between the item creation in the extension and its processing in Chrome.

histogram.name: IOS.ShareExtension.Source
histogram.summary: The source application that sent the external command to Chrome.

histogram.name: IOS.SiriShortcuts.Count
histogram.summary: Counts the number of Chrome Siri Shortcuts that the user has created in the Siri Shortcuts app. This is recorded once during startup. The histogram caps at 20 shortcuts, which is an arbitrary but reasonable limit. Note that shortcuts that have multiple actions are not counted if at least one action isn't a Chrome-provided one. For example, a shortcut that opens URLs in Chrome and then opens URLs in another app won't be counted. As such, this metric undercounts the true number of Chrome shortcuts. This is a restriction of the native Shortcuts API.

histogram.name: IOS.Snapshots.CacheSize
histogram.summary: The overall size of snapshots cache. Recorded when new snapshot is cached.

histogram.name: IOS.SpeechInput.CountryCodeNotDetected
histogram.summary: A boolean that is used to indicate that neither the device's current locale nor the locale corresponding to the device's preferred language has a valid country code. Recorded every time that SpeechInputLocaleConfigImpl attempts to detect the country code but fails to do so.

histogram.name: IOS.Spotlight.Action
histogram.summary: The Spotlight Action pressed by the user.

histogram.name: IOS.Spotlight.Availability
histogram.summary: Tracks the availability of the Spotlight indexation on the device. It is logged once at each cold start. Note: Spotlight may be available on the device but disabled by the user.

histogram.name: IOS.Spotlight.BookmarksIndexingDuration
histogram.summary: Time spent in Spotlight initial indexation of bookmarks.

histogram.name: IOS.Spotlight.BookmarksInitialIndexSize
histogram.summary: Number of bookmarks indexed during initial indexation. Starting in M122, this is batched. Only recorded on successful reindexing.

histogram.name: IOS.Spotlight.BookmarksReindexRestarted
histogram.summary: How many times full bookmarks reindex had to restart due to a model mutation that happened during reindexing. Logged for each interruption (so for 3 interruptions it will log values 1, 2, and 3).

histogram.name: IOS.Spotlight.DonatedIntentType
histogram.summary: Recorded each time an intent is donated.

histogram.name: IOS.Spotlight.LaunchedIntentType
histogram.summary: Recorded each time the app is opened via a Spotlight intent.

histogram.name: IOS.Spotlight.OpenTabsIndexingDuration
histogram.summary: Time spent in Spotlight initial indexation of open tabs.

histogram.name: IOS.Spotlight.OpenTabsInitialIndexSize
histogram.summary: Number of open tabs indexed during initial indexation.

histogram.name: IOS.Spotlight.OpenTabsReindexRestarted
histogram.summary: How many times full open tabs reindex had to restart due to a model mutation that happened during reindexing. Logged for each interruption (so for 3 interruptions it will log values 1, 2, and 3).

histogram.name: IOS.Spotlight.Origin
histogram.summary: This event is recorded each time a Chrome Spotlight entry is selected by the user. The enumeration indicates the nature of the Spotlight entry.

histogram.name: IOS.Spotlight.ReadingListIndexingDuration
histogram.summary: Time spent in Spotlight initial indexation of reading list.

histogram.name: IOS.Spotlight.ReadingListInitialIndexSize
histogram.summary: Number of reading list items indexed during initial indexation.

histogram.name: IOS.Start.Click
histogram.summary: This histogram is logged whenever a click happens on the Start surface.

histogram.name: IOS.Start.Impression
histogram.summary: The type of Start impressions on iOS, split by the feed visibility. Logged each time Start is opened for the user.

histogram.name: IOS.Start.TimeSpent
histogram.summary: The time spent on the Start Home surface as measured from when it was loaded or last brought to the foreground until it was navigated away from or hidden. Only measured on iOS.

histogram.name: IOS.TabGrid.CloseTabs
histogram.summary: The number of Tab Grid items closed with a bulk or a 'Close All' operation. A Tab can be recoreded twice if it is restored and closed again.

histogram.name: IOS.TabGrid.Selection.AddToBookmarks
histogram.summary: The number of Tab Grid items bookmarked with a single add to bookmarks operation from the tab grid selection mode.

histogram.name: IOS.TabGrid.Selection.AddToReadingList
histogram.summary: The number of Tab Grid items added to reading list with a single add to reading list operation from the tab grid selection mode.

histogram.name: IOS.TabGrid.Selection.CloseTabs
histogram.summary: The number of Tab Grid items closed with a single Close Tab(s) operation from the tab grid selection mode.

histogram.name: IOS.TabGrid.Selection.ShareTabs
histogram.summary: The number of Tab Grid items shared with a single share operation from the tab grid selection mode.

histogram.name: IOS.TabGrid.TabSelected.TimeSinceLastActivation
histogram.summary: Recorded when a tab is selected from the TabGrid. Time spent since the last time this tab was made active.

histogram.name: IOS.TabStrip.DragDropGroups
histogram.summary: Records tab group drag and drop interactions on the tab strip. An interaction is recorded twice (one drag and one drop).

histogram.name: IOS.TabStrip.DragDropTabs
histogram.summary: Records tab drag and drop interactions on the tab strip. An interaction is recorded twice (one drag and one drop).

histogram.name: IOS.TabStrip.DragInteraction
histogram.summary: Tracks whether the user moved a tabStrip tab to a new index. Recorded when the user stops the drag interaction.

histogram.name: IOS.TabStrip.DragOrigin
histogram.summary: Records the origin of dropped items in the tab strip.

histogram.name: IOS.TabStrip.DragOrigin.Group
histogram.summary: Records the origin of dropped tab groups in the tab strip.

histogram.name: IOS.TabStrip.TapInteraction
histogram.summary: Tracks whether the user tapped on a tabStrip tab that is not the active one. Recorded when the tabStrip tab is tapped.

histogram.name: IOS.TabSwitcher.DragDropGroups
histogram.summary: Records tab group drag and drop interactions on the tab switcher. An interaction is recorded twice (one drag and one drop).

histogram.name: IOS.TabSwitcher.DragDropMultiSelect
histogram.summary: Records multi-selection drag and drop interactions on the tab switcher. An interaction is recorded twice (one drag and one drop).

histogram.name: IOS.TabSwitcher.DragDropTabs
histogram.summary: Records tab drag and drop interactions on the tab switcher. An interaction is recorded twice (one drag and one drop).

histogram.name: IOS.TabSwitcher.DragOrigin
histogram.summary: Records the origin of dropped items in the tab switcher.

histogram.name: IOS.TabSwitcher.DragOrigin.Group
histogram.summary: Records the origin of dropped tab groups in the tab switcher.

histogram.name: IOS.TabSwitcher.Group.DragOrigin
histogram.summary: Records the origin of dropped items in the tab group view. This is recorded when items are drop in the tab group view.

histogram.name: IOS.TabSwitcher.Idle.IncognitoTabGridPage
histogram.summary: Tracks whether the user closed the incognito tab grid page without doing any meaningful action on any tab grid pages. Meaningful actions are creating, moving, deleting or switching tab. Recorded when the user closed the incognito tab grid page.

histogram.name: IOS.TabSwitcher.Idle.RecentTabs
histogram.summary: Tracks whether the user closed the recent tabs page without doing any meaningful action on any tab grid pages. Meaningful action is opening a tab. Recorded when the user closed the recent tabs page or switched to a tab grid page.

histogram.name: IOS.TabSwitcher.Idle.RegularTabGridPage
histogram.summary: Tracks whether the user closed the regular tab grid page without doing any meaningful action on any tab grid pages. Meaningful actions are creating, moving, deleting or switching tab. Recorded when the user closed the regular tab grid page.

histogram.name: IOS.TabSwitcher.Idle.TabGroups
histogram.summary: Tracks whether the user closed the tab groups page without doing any meaningful action on any tab grid pages. Meaningful action is opening a tab. Recorded when the user closed the tab groups page or switched to a tab grid page.

histogram.name: IOS.TabSwitcher.PageChangeInteraction
histogram.summary: The UI interaction by which the user changed the visible page in the tab switcher. Note that drag interactions can be recorded multiple time for a single drag.

histogram.name: IOS.TabSwitcher.PinnedTabs.DragDropTabs
histogram.summary: Records tab drag and drop interactions in the pinned tab view. An interaction is recorded twice (one drag and one drop).

histogram.name: IOS.TabSwitcher.PinnedTabs.DragOrigin
histogram.summary: Records the origin of dropped items in the pinned tab view.

histogram.name: IOS.TabSwitcher.TimeSpent
histogram.summary: The time the Tab switcher is displayed to the user. This histogram will always be recorded once the user exit the tab switcher. Note: this metric got expired for a while between 2023-05-14 and 2023-06-07.

histogram.name: IOS.TabSwitcher.TimeSpentOpeningExistingTab
histogram.summary: The time it takes for a user to open an existing tab. If the user opens a new tab or closes the tab switcher, this is not recorded.

histogram.name: IOS.TabSwitcher.TimeSpentScrolling
histogram.summary: The time spent while the tab grid is scrolled by the user. This includes the deceleration time.

histogram.name: IOS.TextSelection.EntityDetection.DetectedEntityType
histogram.summary: The entity type detected by running entity detection on user-selected text. This histogram is recorded every time entity detection is attempted on text that the user explicit selects, such as when displaying context menu actions on a long press.

histogram.name: IOS.TextSelection.EntityDetection.FullPageTFLiteModelEvaluationDuration
histogram.summary: Records the time taken for the TFLite text classifier model to extract entities given a full web page text (up to 64k characters).

histogram.name: IOS.TextSelection.EntityDetection.TFLiteModelEvaluationDuration
histogram.summary: Records the time taken for the TFLite text classifier model to extract entities given a text string. This metric does not record the duration for NSDataDetector entity extraction when the TFLite model is unavailable.

histogram.name: IOS.TipsMagicStack.Module.DisplayedType
histogram.summary: Logged when Tips (Magic Stack) is disaplyed for a user. The enumeration indicates which tip was displayed.

histogram.name: IOS.TipsMagicStack.Module.TappedType
histogram.summary: Logged when the user taps on the Tips (Magic Stack) module. The enumeration indicates which tip was interacted with.

histogram.name: IOS.Translate.PageLoad.LanguageDetectionMethod
histogram.summary: The method used to detect language in the web page during the CLD3->TFlite transition.

histogram.name: IOS.TrendingQueries
histogram.summary: Logs a user tapping on a trending query and the index position of that query in the module.

histogram.name: IOS.UnitConversion.DetectedMeasurements
histogram.summary: Records the number of detected measurements in a webpage after the page load.

histogram.name: IOS.UnitConversion.{Type}
histogram.summary: Logs the changes in the source or target units change under a unit type state (unchanged or changed).

variant.name: SourceUnitChangeAfterUnitTypeChange
variant.summary: Recorded once when the source unit change after any unit type change.

variant.name: SourceUnitChangeBeforeUnitTypeChange
variant.summary: Recorded once after a source unit type change before any change of the unit type.

variant.name: TargetUnitChange
variant.summary: Recorded once, when the first target unit change occures, without taking into consideration the changes in the unit type.

histogram.name: IOS.UpgradeCenter.UpgradeFailed
histogram.summary: Logs the failure reasons when Chrome on iOS cannot upgrade its version. Each bucket in the histogram corresponds to a distinct failure reason (see IOSUpgradeCenterFailureReason).

histogram.name: IOS.Variations.FirstRun.SeedApplicationStage
histogram.summary: The stage of applying a downloaded initial variations seed during Chrome first run on platforms that implemented first run variations. This would be emitted on the first run, after Chrome iOS has finished initializing the browser objects for the background handlers, to indicate whether the initial variations seed fetched natively has been applied, and if not, which stage of the variations seed importing process has it reached for debugging purpose.

histogram.name: IOS.Variations.FirstRun.SeedFetchResult
histogram.summary: The result of attempting to fetch an initial variations seed during iOS Chrome first run. Records both the HTTP code and various error values in one enumeration.

histogram.name: IOS.Variations.FirstRun.SeedFetchTime
histogram.summary: The latency of fetching an initial variations seed during iOS Chrome first run. Only considers cases where an HTTP 200 result was received.

histogram.name: IOS.Web.ErrorPagePresentationFailed
histogram.summary: Logged when the error page fails to load. Sometimes, for example, when the web view no longer exists, this error may be expected. Other times, it will have unknown causes. These unknown cases will cause a blank white page to remain displayed in the web content area after the failed load instead of a descriptive error message. Ref: crbug.com/1489167

histogram.name: IOS.Web.FileInput.Clicked
histogram.summary: An enum describing the accept and the multiple attributes of an input file element. Logged when the element is clicked.

histogram.name: IOS.Web.FileInput.ContentState
histogram.summary: An enum describing the state of the file input when clicked (whether it accepts multiple files and whether it already has some files).

histogram.name: IOS.Web.FileInput.ContentState.Drive
histogram.summary: An enum describing the state of the file input when clicked (whether it accepts multiple files and whether it already has some files) specifically when choosing a file from Drive.

histogram.name: IOS.Web.FileInput.EventDropped
histogram.summary: Histogram describing whether a "Choose File" event was dropped in order to record a new incoming "Choose File" event. Logged when a new "Choose File" event is triggered by the web page.

histogram.name: IOS.Web.URLDidChangeToEmptyURL
histogram.summary: A boolean that is used to indicate that the URL property of the WKWebView has changed to a nil or empty URL. Recorded on the KVO of the URL of the WKWebView.

histogram.name: IOS.WebInspector.Enabled
histogram.summary: Records whether Web Inspector support has been enabled by the user. Logged on iOS 16.4+ only, each time that a WKWebView has been created.

histogram.name: IOS.WhatsNew.InstructionsShown
histogram.summary: Recorded each time the instructions of a What's New feature is displayed. The recorded value is the type of the feature that was being viewed.

histogram.name: IOS.WhatsNew.ItemsClickedCount
histogram.summary: The number of clicked What's New items per impression

histogram.name: IOS.WhatsNew.LearnMoreTapped
histogram.summary: Recorded each time the learn more button of a What's New feature is tapped. The recorded value is the type of the feature that was being viewed.

histogram.name: IOS.WhatsNew.PrimaryActionTapped
histogram.summary: Recorded each time the primary button of a What's New feature is tapped. The recorded value is the type of the feature that was being viewed.

histogram.name: IOS.WhatsNew.Shown
histogram.summary: Recorded each time a feature cell in What's New is tapped. The recorded value is the type of the feature that will show.

histogram.name: IOS.WhatsNew.TableViewDidScroll
histogram.summary: Whether or not the table view of the What's New feature was scrolled.

histogram.name: IOS.WhatsNew.TimeSpent
histogram.summary: Logs the time a user spent on What's New.

histogram.name: IOS.WhatsNew.{Type}.TimeSpent
histogram.summary: Logs the time a user spent on each feature of What's New.

histogram.name: IOS.WidgetKit.Action
histogram.summary: Measures UI interactions in WidgetKit extension. Recorded after a user taps in a widget and Chrome is opened.

histogram.name: IOS.WidgetKit.{Status}
histogram.summary: Indicates the {Status} of an iOS 14 widget. Logged when the app goes to foreground. "Current" widgets are logged everytime widgets are detected, "Install" and "Uninstall" are logged only when changes are detected. It is important to consider the bias created towards users that foreground the app more often when doing analysis. This can be accounted by filtering per unique users when looking at the metric.

histogram.name: IOS.WKWebViewFinishBeforeCommit
histogram.summary:
WKWebView should notify navigation commit before navigation finish, but exceptions have been observed. This histogram counts the frequency of this invariant violation at the time when a new navigation is finished. True means navigation finish callback happened before navigation commit.
Expired between M77 and M117.

histogram.name: IOS.{AppVersion}AppLaunchesPerSession
histogram.summary: The number of application launches per "cold start". (A "cold start" is an application launch which occurs when the app is not already running in the background.) Even when the application is in the background, the system may keep it alive if the resource usage is low. This will result in subsequent launches being faster by resuming the exisiting launched application instead of requiring a full, new launch. In the context of feature experiments, a decrease in this metric may signal that a feature is doing more work than necessary while the application is in the background and thus being terminated more frequently by the system.

histogram.name: IOS.{AppVersion}WarmStartCount
histogram.summary: This event is recorded on application launch when the app was not already running in the background (a "cold start"). The value represents how many times the application was brought to the foreground while already running in the background (a "warm start") during the previous session. Cold starts are slower because the entire application must be re-launched, while warm starts are merely a transistion from background to foreground state. In the context of feature experiments, a decrease in this metric may signal that a feature is doing more work than necessary while the application is in the background and thus being terminated more frequently by the system. NOTE: This metric is logged for the prior session, which may have been a different application version than the version logging this metric.

histogram.name: ManualFallback.PresentedOptions.AllPasswords
histogram.summary: [iOS Only] Tracks the number of credentials presented to the user in the "Use other password..." view in Manual Fallback. This is logged everytime the user opens this view.

histogram.name: ManualFallback.PresentedOptions.CreditCards
histogram.summary: [iOS Only] Tracks the number of cards presented to the user in Manual Fallback. This is logged everytime the user opens this view. Warning: this histogram was expired from 2023-12-10 to 2024-4-15; data may be missing.

histogram.name: ManualFallback.PresentedOptions.Passwords
histogram.summary: [iOS Only] Tracks the number of credentials presented to the user in the Passwords Manual Fallback view. This is logged everytime the user opens this view.

histogram.name: ManualFallback.PresentedOptions.Profiles
histogram.summary: [iOS Only] Tracks the number of profiles presented to the user in Manual Fallback. This is logged everytime the user opens this view. Warning: this histogram was expired from 2024-1-28 to 2024-4-15; data may be missing.

histogram.name: ManualFallback.VisibleSuggestions.ExpandIcon.OpenAddresses
histogram.summary: [iOS Only] Tracks the number of autofill suggestions present when the user taps on the expand button in the keyboard accessory to open the address manual fallback menu.

histogram.name: ManualFallback.VisibleSuggestions.ExpandIcon.OpenPasswords
histogram.summary: [iOS Only] Tracks the number of autofill suggestions present when the user taps on the expand button in the keyboard accessory to open the password manual fallback menu.

histogram.name: ManualFallback.VisibleSuggestions.ExpandIcon.OpenPaymentMethods
histogram.summary: [iOS Only] Tracks the number of autofill suggestions present when the user taps on the expand button in the keyboard accessory to open the payment method manual fallback menu.

histogram.name: ManualFallback.VisibleSuggestions.OpenCreditCards
histogram.summary: [iOS Only] Tracks the number of autofill suggestions present when the user taps on the credit card button in manual fallback. Warning: this histogram was expired from 2023-12-10 to 2024-4-15; data may be missing.

histogram.name: ManualFallback.VisibleSuggestions.OpenPasswords
histogram.summary: [iOS Only] Tracks the number of password suggestions present when the user taps on the password button in manual fallback. Warning: this histogram was expired from 2023-1-07 to 2024-4-15; data may be missing.

histogram.name: ManualFallback.VisibleSuggestions.OpenProfiles
histogram.summary: [iOS Only] Tracks the number of autofill suggestions present when the user taps on the profiles (address) button in manual fallback. Warning: this histogram was expired from 2023-05-01 to 2024-4-15; data may be missing.
